city.cs.engine

Class SolidFixture

  • java.lang.Object
    • city.cs.engine.Fixture
      • city.cs.engine.SolidFixture

  • public class SolidFixture
extends Fixture
    A component of a rigid body. A body can have multiple fixtures but fixtures cannot be shared among multiple bodies.

    • Method Detail

      • setFriction

        public void setFriction(float friction)
        Set the coefficient of friction for this shape. When two bodies are pushed together, there is a force (friction) that limits the extent that they can slide along each other, and this force is limited to a certain fraction of the force pushing the two bodies together.

        This proportion is the coefficient of friction, and it depends on the nature of the two bodies. A value of 0 means no friction, higher values mean more friction. A value of 1 is very strong but even higher values are allowed. For example ice would have a coefficient of friction close to zero, while rubber would have a high value.

        The effective friction between two shapes is calculated using the geometric mean: sqrt(f1 * f2). Thus if one of the fixtures has zero friction, the contact will have no friction.

        Parameters:
        friction - the new friction coefficient for this fixture

      • getFriction

        public float getFriction()
        The current coefficient of friction for this fixture.
        Returns:
        the friction coefficient

      • setRestitution

        public void setRestitution(float restitution)
        Set the coefficient of restitution (bounciness) for this fixture. The coefficient of restitution is a number between 0 and 1. A value of 0 means no bounce (inelastic collision), a value of 1 means perfect bounce (perfectly elastic collision). Values higher than 1 result in impossible behaviour, in that the total energy of the associated bodies effectively increases as a result of their colliding. The effective restitution between two fixtures is taken to be the maximum of their two restitutions.
        Parameters:
        restitution - the new restitution coefficient for this shape

      • getRestitution

        public float getRestitution()
        The current coefficient of restitution for this shape.
        Returns:
        the restitution coefficient
